node.title: No two-legged intercontinental playoffs for last places at Qatar World Cup
node.alt: Mat Ryan celebrates with fans after Socceroos qualify for 2018 World Cup
node.description: If Australia has to go in the intercontinental playoffs for the World Cup finals in Qatar, they won't be able to clinch a spot in front of home fans or a hostile away crowd, with FIFA saying playoffs will be one-off games at neutral venues.
node.content:
["FIFA has\u00a0confirmed the World Cup 2022 inter-confederation qualifying playoffs will be played as one-off matches at neutral venues.", "The decision means the Socceroos would be denied a sold-out home tie were they to be forced into the playoffs.", "But they would also avoid a hostile away leg as has been encountered in the past.", "The matches will feature one nation each from the Asia, South America, Oceania and North America\u00a0confederations, and will take place on June 13 and 14, 2022.", "On November 26, FIFA will\u00a0make the draw at its Zurich headquarters, although the nations representing each confederation\u00a0will not be known for some months yet.", "FIFA will make the World Cup tournament draw\u00a0on April 1 in Doha.", "It has been speculated the matches will be in Qatar, but as that would be in the middle of the summer in extreme heat a European venue may be preferred.", "Wherever it is it is unlikely to be a friendly time for Australian television viewers, though a European venue would attract support from Australians overseas.", "Australia has twice needed the inter-confederation play-offs to win through to the World Cup in its past four appearances.", "In 2005, the Socceroos ended a 32-year World Cup drought by beating Uruguay on penalties after a two-legged play-off, and in 2017 Mile Jedinak's hat-trick saw Australia past Honduras en route to Russia for the 2018 World Cup.", "On both occasions more than 77,000 people packed into Homebush Stadium for the final leg, providing the final push for Australia's qualifying effort.", "After losing play-offs to Uruguay (2001), Iran (1997), Argentina (1993) and Scotland (1985), Australia could be forced into another inter-confederation play-off next year to reach Qatar.", "", "
The Socceroos have had to travel to some hostile venues for past Intercontinental playoffs, such as Montevideo in 2001 against Uruguay.(Getty Images: / Allsport: Gary M Prior)
", "Graham Arnold's side currently sits third in its qualifying group.", "If the Socceroos remain there they will play the third-placed team from the other Asian qualifying pool, with the winner progressing to the final play-off.", "The decision is unlikely to be welcomed by Football Australia.", "Given limited success at World Cup finals, the home play-off legs against Uruguay and Honduras are two of the most memorable occasions in Australian football history.", "The play-off also brings bumper pay days for host countries.", "AAP"]
